description:
We're unique. You should be, too. We're changing lives every day. For both our patients and our team members. Are you innovative and entrepreneurial minded? Is your work ethic and ambition off the charts? Do you inspire others with your kindness and joy? We're different than most primary care providers. We're rapidly expanding and we need great people to join our team. The Associate Director, Sales Talent Development partners with the Director of Operations, Sales Talent Development to develop, facilitate, implement, and manage sales training courses within assigned divisional geography. This role will oversee the management of a team of Sales Training Managers responsible for delivering training. In addition, this role will partner with the Divisional Leadership Team (Divisional President, Regional Vice Presidents, Directors of Growth, Divisional Sales Directors and Center DYADs) in the support and execution of all sales training. ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/
Responsibilities:
Management and Team Support Responsible for onboarding, training, coaching, and management of a team of Sales Training Managers (STMs) in the delivery of best-in-class training. To include:
classroom, field, LMS, and virtual learning Responsible for onboarding and training of Sales Leadership and Support Roles in classroom, field, LMS, and virtual learning Collaborate with STMs to identify strengths and areas for improvement in training solutions, and appropriate steps to improve training effectiveness (e.g., content, activities, materials, delivery methods, etc.) Supports all sales and operational roles to provide training and support per individual divisional goals Manages the divisional sales training calendars, to include field travel, divisional virtual trainings, and classroom training schedules Conducts updates and debriefs as necessary with appropriate leadership to communicate training experiences/effectiveness, based on available feedback and data (e.g. reports, trainers, learners, their managers, etc.) Supporting the development of and adhering to minimum standards of learning excellence. Providing coaching and mentoring to sales training team as needed Ensures alignment of training with our mission, values, and patient promise Partner with the Center of Excellence (Growth) to include RVP and Director of Broker Partnership to create and implement divisional growth training strategies Partner with Director of Sales Talent Development and Divisional Presidents to build and implement effective sales training per divisional goals/requests Responsible for reporting and tracking success of new hires Facilitation & Accreditation:
Responsible for knowledge, understanding, and delivery of all sales training content Passes accreditation by Director, Sales Talent Development for the delivery of leadership training and other sales training as needed Delivers train the trainer to training team and supports initial training rollout as needed. Accredits Sales Training Managers for classroom facilitation delivery Engage with training managers and field trainers post-training to obtain additional feedback on training effectiveness (e.g. focus groups, follow-up surveys, collaborating with trainers as appropriate Develops, facilitates, and implements leadership training (both virtually and LIVE/classroom) Assists the Director of Operations Sales Talent Development (and other sales leaders) with the facilitation of corporate sales and operations training, as needed Field Travel:
Travels within the assigned division to support divisional leadership and sales training team goals and initiatives (e.g., participating in sales meetings, events, center events, trainings, etc.) 40% travel required Content Development:
Provide support to the training team by creating effective, strategic, and useful training materials that support the sales training managers and the overall sales and operational goals Assists STMs in the creation of new training materials to include PowerPoint presentations, guides, job aids and sales enhancements tools. We're ChenMed and we're transforming healthcare for seniors and changing America's healthcare for the better. Family-owned and physician-led, our unique approach allows us to improve the health and well-being of the populations we serve. We're growing rapidly as we seek to rescue more and more seniors from inadequate health care. ChenMed is changing lives for the people we serve and the people we hire. With great compensation, comprehensive benefits, career development and advancement opportunities and so much more, our employees enjoy great work-life balance and opportunities to grow. Join our team who make a difference in people's lives every single day. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Org Development, Business Admin or closely related field 5
years' experience in facilitating training and/or field sales training experience 5
years' experience in sales training content development and implementation 5
years' experience selling. Healthcare sales and/or Medicare Insurance sales preferred 3-5 years' experience managing a team of trainers or sales reps to proven successful outcomes Intermediate Microsoft Word and PowerPoint skills (used on a regular basis) Willingness to travel up to 40% of the time Additional Qualifications Excellent communication skills at different organizational levels Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively High level of Emotional Intelligence (knowledge of) Experience and understanding of personality assessments (Disc, Myers Briggs, etc.) Dynamic/passionate classroom facilitator/presenter Ability to give appropriate feedback and hold team members accountable to performance goals Strong passion for helping drive successful outcomes in others Self-motivated and goal oriented Ability to work and thrive in a fast paced, constant change work environment Intermediate knowledge of Sales Force Experience working with Medicare/Medicare Advantage plans Bilingual a plus, not required
